title: How to find solutions to a second degree diophantine equation (diophantine equations, math) - Quora

response.answer_text: pls c a simple example: find the integral soln of x+ y = x² - x y + y². the discriminant of x² - (y + 1)x + (y² - y) = 0 is (y + 1)² - 4(y² - y) = -3(y - 1)² + 4 ≥ 0 => (y -1)²≤ 4/3 ≤ 1 => y = 0, 1 or 2. when y = 0, x = 0 or 1. when y = 1, x = 0 or 2. when y = 2, x = 1 or 2. there 6 solns: (0, 0), (1, 0), (0, 1), (2, 1), (1, 2) and (2, 2). for details, pls c an introduction to diophantine eqns by anddrescu, andrica and cucurezeanu.
